title: APT / WCW MAIN
description: Working Class Woman in her room, apartment #20.

dialogueTree.title: Working Class Woman: "She's crying, too heartbroken to no..."
dialogueTree.text: She's crying, too heartbroken to notice you standing next to her.

links.title: Empathy: "What are you still doing here?! She..."
links.text: What are you still doing here?! She needs time to be alone now.

dialogueTree.title: Working Class Woman: "She looks up, too anxious to say an..."
dialogueTree.text: She looks up, too anxious to say anything.

links.title: You: ""So... how have you been?""
links.text: "So... how have you been?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""How have I been?" she shakes her h..."
links.text: "How have I been?" she shakes her head. "You're not here to discuss *me* -- what is this about, officer?"

links.title: Drama: "Can't write a scene without knowing..."
links.text: Can't write a scene without knowing the actors. Ask more, get comfortable around her.

links.title: You: ""I noticed you were cooking somethi..."
links.text: "I noticed you were cooking something."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""People gotta eat." She rubs her ha..."
links.text: "People gotta eat." She rubs her hands together, anxious. "What is this about? Why are you suddenly asking me about my cooking?"

links.title: Half Light: "She's afraid -- and so are you. Man..."
links.text: She's afraid -- and so are you. Man up and cut to the point.

links.title: You: ""You live here with Victor, your hu..."
links.text: "You live here with Victor, your husband, right?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""It's me, Victor, and the kids here..."
links.text: "It's me, Victor, and the kids here," she nods. "We have two daughters, Jennie and Jolie."

links.title: You: ""Yes, I remember, you mentioned the..."
links.text: "Yes, I remember, you mentioned them at the bookstand."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Mhmh, they came home later. They'r..."
links.text: "Mhmh, they came home later. They're good girls."

links.title: You: ""How old are your daughters?""
links.text: "How old are your daughters?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Jolie is sixteen and Jennie is tur..."
links.text: "Jolie is sixteen and Jennie is turning eighteen next month."

links.title: You: "(Look around.) "And where is everyb..."
links.text: (Look around.) "And where is everybody? I don't see anyone home."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""The girls are staying at their fri..."
links.text: "The girls are staying at their friend's place tonight, and Victor is... out."

links.title: Composure: "She swallows visibly."
links.text: She swallows visibly.

links.title: You: ""Out where?""
links.text: "Out where?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""As I already told you, he has a pr..."
links.text: "As I already told you, he has a problem with drinking. And so he... disappears every now and then."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""He's probably in the Pox, drinking..."
links.text: "He's probably in the Pox, drinking with his friends. I sent him to the library a few days ago, but I guess something came up..." She smiles sourly.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""He... has a problem with drinking...."
links.text: "He... has a problem with drinking. And so he... disappears every now and then."

links.title: You: ""He still hasn't come home?""
links.text: "He still hasn't come home?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No." She stops."
links.text: "No." She stops.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Why, do you have any news?""
links.text: "Why, do you have any news?"

links.title: You: ""To your knowledge, did he make it..."
links.text: "To your knowledge, did he make it to the library?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No. I guess I'll find out when he..."
links.text: "No. I guess I'll find out when he decides to come back home." She looks at the front door.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""It shouldn't be long from now. He'..."
links.text: "It shouldn't be long from now. He's never gone for more than a few days."

links.title: You: ""What was the name of the library?""
links.text: "What was the name of the library?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Oh, it's in Jamrock. The one at Me..."
links.text: "Oh, it's in Jamrock. The one at Meroe street. I don't know the official name."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Central Jamrock Public Library?""
links.text: "Central Jamrock Public Library?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I think, yes. If that's the one on..."
links.text: "I think, yes. If that's the one on Meroe."

links.title: Logic: "It is."
links.text: It is.

links.title: You: ""Central Jamrock Public Library?""
links.text: "Central Jamrock Public Library?"

links.title: You: ""What was he supposed to do in the..."
links.text: "What was he supposed to do in the library?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Just to return a book of mine, why..."
links.text: "Just to return a book of mine, why?" She looks at you quizzically. "Why all those questions, detective? Did he..."

links.title: Empathy: "Do something? Break something? It's..."
links.text: Do something? Break something? It's a fool's hope.

links.title: You: ""Was it 'The Glinting Curve' by M...."
links.text: "Was it 'The Glinting Curve' by M. Thibault?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Yes." She becomes unsettled as she..."
links.text: "Yes." She becomes unsettled as she says that, her forehead scrunching up into a worried expression.

links.title: You: ""What was the name of the book?""
links.text: "What was the name of the book?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I think it was Thibault's 'The Gli..."
links.text: "I think it was Thibault's 'The Glinting Curve'." She tucks a strand of hair behind her ear. "It was pretty good..."

links.title: You: ""Do you remember what he was wearin..."
links.text: "Do you remember what he was wearing when you last saw him?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""His old leather jacket.""
links.text: "His old leather jacket."

links.title: You: ""Can you describe it?""
links.text: "Can you describe it?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Um, it's just your average brown l..."
links.text: "Um, it's just your average brown leather jacket. But he bought it as a teenager, so..."

links.title: Empathy: "It reminded him of his teenage year..."
links.text: It reminded him of his teenage years.

links.title: You: ""What about the inner lining?""
links.text: "What about the inner lining?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Yes..." She stops. "The lining is..."
links.text: "Yes..." She stops. "The lining is hand-sewn. It's blue; I tried to make the thing more weatherproof since he's running around with it in the middle of winter."

links.title: You: ""No distinctive features?""
links.text: "No distinctive features?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No, well..." She stops. "The linin..."
links.text: "No, well..." She stops. "The lining is hand-sewn. It's blue; I tried to make the thing more weatherproof since he's running around with it in the middle of winter."

links.title: You: ""There's something else I have to t..."
links.text: "There's something else I have to tell you..."

links.title: Working Class Woman: "She folds her hands across her ches..."
links.text: She folds her hands across her chest.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Here it comes."
links.text: Here it comes.

links.title: You: "Tell her about the dead body."
links.text: Tell her about the dead body.

links.title: Empathy: "You've done this before. Just keep..."
links.text: You've done this before. Just keep your focus.

links.title: You: "God, do I just say he's *dead* like..."
links.text: God, do I just say he's *dead* like that...

links.title: Empathy: "Yes. That's the most important thin..."
links.text: Yes. That's the most important thing. Use that word.

links.title: Rhetoric: "No euphemisms, this is what you cam..."
links.text: No euphemisms, this is what you came here for.

links.title: You: ""Ma'am, I'm very sorry to say, but..."
links.text: "Ma'am, I'm very sorry to say, but your husband, Victor Méjean, was found dead on the Martinaise boardwalk."

links.title: Working Class Woman: "She blinks. "What-did-you-say?""
links.text: She blinks. "What-did-you-say?"

links.title: Pain Threshold: "A great and terrible spike. The blo..."
links.text: A great and terrible spike. The blood freezes in her veins.

links.title: You: ""Your husband, Victor Méjean, is de..."
links.text: "Your husband, Victor Méjean, is dead. I'm very sorry for your loss, ma'am."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Oh." She touches her neck, eyes pa..."
links.text: "Oh." She touches her neck, eyes pale like pearls in seawater.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Oh," she says again, "But he was j..."
links.text: "Oh," she says again, "But he was just..." She looks at the kitchen table, where two cigarette butts are still in the tray.

links.title: Empathy: "But he was just here. Alive."
links.text: But he was just here. Alive.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We understand this comes as a huge..."
links.text: "We understand this comes as a huge shock. I want you to know that me and my partner," he points at you, "are here for you if you have any questions. Take your time, ma'am."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""What happened to him?" She turns t..."
links.text: "What happened to him?" She turns to you. Her neck and cheeks are covered with red blotches, her double chin is shaking.

links.title: You: ""It's still early to say, but at fi..."
links.text: "It's still early to say, but at first glance it seems like he slipped and hit his head."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Was he drunk?""
links.text: "Was he drunk?"

links.title: You: ""Alcohol may have played a role, ye..."
links.text: "Alcohol may have played a role, yes."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I see..." She withdraws, trying to..."
links.text: "I see..." She withdraws, trying to picture the scene. "And you just... found him there? Lying in the cold?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""How long had he been there?""
links.text: "How long had he been there?"

links.title: Empathy: "If you say 'Two days, maybe', it wi..."
links.text: If you say 'Two days, maybe', it will be etched in her mind forever.

links.title: You: ""It's hard to say at this point.""
links.text: "It's hard to say at this point."

links.title: Working Class Woman: "She blinks, eyes welling up with te..."
links.text: She blinks, eyes welling up with tears, as her hands start searching for something from the pockets of her dress.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "The handkerchief!"
links.text: The handkerchief!

links.title: You: ""Here, take this." (Give her the li..."
links.text: "Here, take this." (Give her the lieutenant's handkerchief.)

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Yes, thank you." She smiles a smal..."
links.text: "Yes, thank you." She smiles a small, terrified smile, then wipes away her tears. She looks disoriented.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Is there anyone we could call for..."
links.text: "Is there anyone we could call for you? A friend, a family member, someone who could be here for you?"

links.title: You: "(No words. Just give her the lieute..."
links.text: (No words. Just give her the lieutenant's handkerchief.)

links.title: Working Class Woman: "A small, terrified smile quivers on..."
links.text: A small, terrified smile quivers on her face as she takes the handkerchief and wipes away the tears. She looks disoriented.

links.title: You: "Don't give her the lieutenant's han..."
links.text: Don't give her the lieutenant's handkerchief, it's too special.

links.title: Working Class Woman: "The woman wipes her face with a sle..."
links.text: The woman wipes her face with a sleeve and manages to conjure up a small terrified smile. She looks disoriented.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Here." The lieutenant takes out hi..."
links.text: "Here." The lieutenant takes out his handkerchief and offers it to the woman. She nods and slowly wipes away her tears.

links.title: You: ""Is there anyone we could call for..."
links.text: "Is there anyone we could call for you? A friend, a family member, someone who could be here for you?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No, no..." She breathes in. "I jus..."
links.text: "No, no..." She breathes in. "I just need to tell my girls..." The air gets sucked out of her lungs suddenly.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "It burns like acid."
links.text: It burns like acid.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Unreal."
links.text: Unreal.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""God, should I call them? Should I..."
links.text: "God, should I call them? Should I tell them to come home?"

links.title: Empathy: "No. A day."
links.text: No. A day.

links.title: You: ""Yes, they should know. Do you want..."
links.text: "Yes, they should know. Do you want us to call them and ask them here?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No, I'll do it myself, I just..."..."
links.text: "No, I'll do it myself, I just..." She breathes again, holding on to her left side like she's in pain.

links.title: Endurance: "She can't take much more. Her stoma..."
links.text: She can't take much more. Her stomach is churning. Soon she will have to go to the bathroom and scream.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Just tell me, what do I need to do..."
links.text: "Just tell me, what do I need to do next? Where is he? Can I see him?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We've taken him to the city morgue..."
links.text: "We've taken him to the city morgue. The local coroner will be contacting you shortly to arrange the funeral. Here's his number in case you want to contact him earlier." He hands her a leaflet with the morgue's contact information.

links.title: Drama: "A very good call."
links.text: A very good call.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Is there anything else that the RC..."
links.text: "Is there anything else that the RCM could do for you?

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No, I'll call you if something com..."
links.text: "No, I'll call you if something comes up, I'm still..." She rubs her face, runs her fingers over cheeks that have become numb.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Thank you." She looks down. "Thank..."
links.text: "Thank you." She looks down. "Thank you for telling me. I'll call, if..." She runs out of breath.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "These are her last reserves of stre..."
links.text: These are her last reserves of strength. Her muscles will give in soon. Already she starts to shake.

links.title: You: ""Again, I'm very sorry, ma'am.""
links.text: "Again, I'm very sorry, ma'am."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant nods at the woman, t..."
links.text: The lieutenant nods at the woman, then looks back at you, his voice lowered: "We should step outside and talk."

links.title: You: "[Set the library card by her. Leave..."
links.text: [Set the library card by her. Leave the room.]

links.title: Empathy: "You know the answer to this. Oddly,..."
links.text: You know the answer to this. Oddly, you just do.

links.title: You: ""We've taken him to the city morgue..."
links.text: "We've taken him to the city morgue. The local coroner will be contacting you shortly to arrange the funeral. In the meantime, you can always call the RCM if you have any questions."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I see. Well, thank you for... tell..."
links.text: "I see. Well, thank you for... telling me." She rubs her face, runs her fingers over cheeks that have become numb.

links.title: Drama: "A very good call. You must leave no..."
links.text: A very good call. You must leave now, sire.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Thank you for telling, me officer...."
links.text: "Thank you for telling, me officer..." She looks down.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "These are her last reserves of stre..."
links.text: These are her last reserves of strength. Her muscles will give in soon. Already she starts to shake.

links.title: You: ""Again, I'm very sorry, ma'am." [Se..."
links.text: "Again, I'm very sorry, ma'am." [Set the library card by her. Leave the room.]

links.title: Working Class Woman: "..."
You: ""No, take a day to recover. You'll..."
links.text: "No, take a day to recover. You'll be better prepared when they come home tomorrow."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Good, that's probably the right th..."
links.text: "Good, that's probably the right thing, thank you..." She nods, but with a wretched expression.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""My handkerchief..." She tries to s..."
links.text: "My handkerchief..." She tries to smile through the tears, as she rubs her face with hands like a child.

links.title: You: ""It couldn't have been long.""
links.text: "It couldn't have been long."

links.title: You: ""Two days, maybe.""
links.text: "Two days, maybe."

links.title: You: ""We don't know yet, but we will let..."
links.text: "We don't know yet, but we will let you know when the results arrive."

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: You: ""It was an accident -- he fell thro..."
links.text: "It was an accident -- he fell through a hole in the boardwalk and hit his head."

links.title: You: ""I understand that this may come as..."
links.text: "I understand that this may come as a huge shock. I want you to know that I'm here for you if you have any questions. Take your time, ma'am, I'm not going anywhere."

links.title: Empathy: "I don't want to."
links.text: I don't want to.

links.title: You: "Wait, what?"
links.text: Wait, what?

links.title: Empathy: "There has been enough pain."
links.text: There has been enough pain.

links.title: You: "But we *have to*."
links.text: But we *have to*.

links.title: Empathy: "I don't want to do this."
links.text: I don't want to do this.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "*Force* yourself. Slap yourself."
links.text: *Force* yourself. Slap yourself.

links.title: You: "(Turn to Kim.) "I don't want to do..."
links.text: (Turn to Kim.) "I don't want to do this."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Do what?""
links.text: "Do what?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Officer..." the lieutenant warns y..."
links.text: "Officer..." the lieutenant warns you.

links.title: Empathy: "Too late, you ruined it, just say i..."
links.text: Too late, you ruined it, just say it now.

links.title: You: "(Turn to Kim.) "It seems like there..."
links.text: (Turn to Kim.) "It seems like there's a part of me that refuses to do this."

links.title: You: "(Slap your cheek.) "Stupid... stupi..."
links.text: (Slap your cheek.) "Stupid... stupid... just say it..."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Say what?" She looks frightened."
links.text: "Say what?" She looks frightened.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Officer..." the lieutenant warns y..."
links.text: "Officer..." the lieutenant warns you.

links.title: You: "(Turn to Billie.) "I don't want to..."
links.text: (Turn to Billie.) "I don't want to do this."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Do what?""
links.text: "Do what?"

links.title: Empathy: "Too late, you ruined it, just say i..."
links.text: Too late, you ruined it, just say it now.

links.title: You: ""Your husband's dead.""
links.text: "Your husband's dead."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Excuse me, what?" She blinks. "Wha..."
links.text: "Excuse me, what?" She blinks. "What-did-you-say?"

links.title: Pain Threshold: "She's in pain. She's in so much pai..."
links.text: She's in pain. She's in so much pain and so are you, your chest is burning.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "You sense that the lieutenant is re..."
links.text: You sense that the lieutenant is ready to say something -- don't let him. Fix this yourself, you did this.

links.title: You: "(Raise your palm.) "Kim, I can hand..."
links.text: (Raise your palm.) "Kim, I can handle this. Let me."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant closes his mouth, bu..."
links.text: The lieutenant closes his mouth, but he doesn't look pleased.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Just tell me, what happened to Vic..."
links.text: "Just tell me, what happened to Victor?" She looks first at the lieutenant, then back at you.

links.title: You: "Let him talk."
links.text: Let him talk.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We're very sorry to inform you, bu..."
links.text: "We're very sorry to inform you, but your husband, Victor Méjean, was found dead this morning on the Martinaise boardwalk."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant steps in. "We're ver..."
links.text: The lieutenant steps in. "We're very sorry to inform you, but your husband, Victor Méjean, was found dead this morning on the Martinaise boardwalk."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Oh." She touches her neck, eyes pa..."
links.text: "Oh." She touches her neck, eyes pale like pearls in seawater.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Oh," she says again, "But he was j..."
links.text: "Oh," she says again, "But he was just..." She looks at the kitchen table, where two cigarette butts are still in the tray.

links.title: Empathy: "He was just here. Alive."
links.text: He was just here. Alive.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I understand that this comes as a..."
links.text: "I understand that this comes as a huge shock. I want you to know that me and my partner," he points at you, "are here for you if you have any questions. We're very sorry for your loss, ma'am."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""What happened to him? Tell me." He..."
links.text: "What happened to him? Tell me." Her neck and cheeks are covered with red blotches, her double chin is shaking.

links.title: You: ""Your husband has expired.""
links.text: "Your husband has expired."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Expired?" She narrows her eyes. "L..."
links.text: "Expired?" She narrows her eyes. "Like a *milk carton*?"

links.title: You: ""No, he's dead.""
links.text: "No, he's dead."

links.title: You: ""He's in a better place now.""
links.text: "He's in a better place now."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Where? Did he run *away*?""
links.text: "Where? Did he run *away*?"

links.title: You: ""I said that he's dead.""
links.text: "I said that he's dead."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Oh.""
links.text: "Oh."

links.title: You: ""Just dead.""
links.text: "Just dead."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Yes, I..." She chokes on something..."
links.text: "Yes, I..." She chokes on something, clutching on to her neck.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I'm sorry, I just need a... I don'..."
links.text: "I'm sorry, I just need a... I don't know what to say." She rests her hand on her forehead, eyes pale like pearls in seawater.

links.title: You: ""I don't want to do this.""
links.text: "I don't want to do this."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""What?" She stares at you with hazy..."
links.text: "What?" She stares at you with hazy eyes.

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I guess what I want to know is......"
links.text: "I guess what I want to know is... how did he die?"

links.title: You: ""He drank himself to death.""
links.text: "He drank himself to death."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""And you just... found him there? L..."
links.text: "And you just... found him there? Lying in the cold?" She shakes her head.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""How long had he *been* there?""
links.text: "How long had he *been* there?"

links.title: You: ""It's hard to say.""
links.text: "It's hard to say."

links.title: Working Class Woman: "She doesn't reply. Her eyes well up..."
links.text: She doesn't reply. Her eyes well up with tears, as she struggles to keep it together.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "You hear the clock ticking in the c..."
links.text: You hear the clock ticking in the children's room.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Is there anyone we could call for..."
links.text: "Is there anyone we could call for you? A friend, a family member, someone who could be here for you?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No, no..." She breathes in. "I jus..."
links.text: "No, no..." She breathes in. "I just need to tell my girls..." The air gets sucked out of her lungs suddenly.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "It burns like acid."
links.text: It burns like acid.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Unreal."
links.text: Unreal.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""God, should I call them? Should I..."
links.text: "God, should I call them? Should I tell them to come home?"

links.title: You: "Smack your lips."
links.text: Smack your lips.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Alright, I'll call them..." She br..."
links.text: "Alright, I'll call them..." She breathes in again, trying to steady herself.

links.title: Endurance: "She can't take much more. Her stoma..."
links.text: She can't take much more. Her stomach is churning. Soon she will have to go to the bathroom and scream.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Just tell me, what do I need to do..."
links.text: "Just tell me, what do I need to do next? Where is he? Can I see him?"

links.title: Drama: "For god's sake. Lie."
links.text: For god's sake. Lie.

links.title: You: ""I don't know where they go...""
links.text: "I don't know where they go..."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No, I meant -- where is *his body*..."
links.text: "No, I meant -- where is *his body*?!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He was taken to the city morgue. T..."
links.text: "He was taken to the city morgue. The local coroner will be contacting you shortly to arrange the funeral. Here's his number in case you want to contact him earlier." He hands her a leaflet with the morgue's contact information.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Is there anything else that the RC..."
links.text: "Is there anything else that the RCM could do for you?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No. I'll call you if something com..."
links.text: "No. I'll call you if something comes up, I'm still a bit..." She rubs her face, blotchy and numb.

links.title: You: ""Sorry I couldn't do this, I have a..."
links.text: "Sorry I couldn't do this, I have a brain condition..." (Tap on your head.)

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""A brain condition?""
links.text: "A brain condition?"

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Yes. You're a total fucking horror..."
links.text: Yes. You're a total fucking horror show.

links.title: Volition: "No-no! Stop now."
links.text: No-no! Stop now.

links.title: You: ""I drank too much and now I can't d..."
links.text: "I drank too much and now I can't do anything right anymore."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Yes," she says sharply, "that's wh..."
links.text: "Yes," she says sharply, "that's what happened to Victor too."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Apologies, my partner," the lieute..."
links.text: "Apologies, my partner," the lieutenant steps in, giving you a sideways glance, "did *not* mean to make light of the situation."

links.title: You: ""You know what, it doesn't matter...."
links.text: "You know what, it doesn't matter. I'll just... leave."

links.title: You: ""Alright, that's it then.""
links.text: "Alright, that's it then."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Again, if there's anything we coul..."
links.text: "Again, if there's anything we could do for you, then don't hesitate to call the RCM, ma'am."

links.title: Working Class Woman: "She just nods, distant and inconsol..."
links.text: She just nods, distant and inconsolable. The bed springs rattle beneath her as she begins to shake.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "These are her last reserves of stre..."
links.text: These are her last reserves of strength. Her muscles will give in soon. To a scream.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I'll take it from here. Thank you...."
links.text: "I'll take it from here. Thank you." She points at the front door, breathing fast now. Holding herself back.

links.title: You: "[Set the library card by her. Leave..."
links.text: [Set the library card by her. Leave the room.]

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I'll take it from here. Thank you...."
links.text: "I'll take it from here. Thank you." She points at the front door, breathing fast now. Holding herself back.

links.title: You: ""It's still there, on the boardwalk.""
links.text: "It's still there, on the boardwalk."

links.title: You: ""It's in the morgue.""
links.text: "It's in the morgue."

links.title: You: ""He's still there, on the boardwalk.""
links.text: "He's still there, on the boardwalk."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""You haven't even taken him away?!"..."
links.text: "You haven't even taken him away?!" There's alarm in her voice.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, we *have*.""
links.text: "No, we *have*."

links.title: You: ""No, but we will. We will take him..."
links.text: "No, but we will. We will take him to the city morgue."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I can't..." She covers her mouth...."
links.text: "I can't..." She covers her mouth. "I can't believe he's still *there*, this is *madness*."

links.title: You: ""He's in the morgue.""
links.text: "He's in the morgue."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""And who should I contact...?""
links.text: "And who should I contact...?"

links.title: Empathy: "RCM? I wish Kim was here..."
links.text: RCM? I wish Kim was here...

links.title: You: ""I really don't know.""
links.text: "I really don't know."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Alright, I'll call the RCM then,"..."
links.text: "Alright, I'll call the RCM then," she nods to herself.

links.title: You: ""RCM?""
links.text: "RCM?"

links.title: You: "Look away."
links.text: Look away.

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: You: ""Please don't cry.""
links.text: "Please don't cry."

links.title: You: "(Mumble.) "I don't want to do this...."
links.text: (Mumble.) "I don't want to do this..."

links.title: You: ""For a few days at least.""
links.text: "For a few days at least."

links.title: You: ""Very long, ma'am. I'm sorry.""
links.text: "Very long, ma'am. I'm sorry."

links.title: You: ""He fell and smashed his head again..."
links.text: "He fell and smashed his head against the bench."

links.title: You: ""Trust me, ma'am, you *don't* want..."
links.text: "Trust me, ma'am, you *don't* want to know."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Why, it's *that bad*?""
links.text: "Why, it's *that bad*?"

links.title: Half Light: "You stupid... *why* did you say tha..."
links.text: You stupid... *why* did you say that?!

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It looks like he slipped on the bo..."
links.text: "It looks like he slipped on the boardwalk -- fatally, I'm afraid. It was just a very unfortunate accident, although alcohol may have played a role."

links.title: You: "(Turn to Billie.) "It seems like th..."
links.text: (Turn to Billie.) "It seems like there's a part of me that refuses to do this."

links.title: You: "(Slap your cheek.) "Stupid... stupi..."
links.text: (Slap your cheek.) "Stupid... stupid... just say it..."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Say what?" She looks frightened."
links.text: "Say what?" She looks frightened.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Working Class Woman: ""It's you from the bookstand... Did..."
dialogueTree.text: "It's you from the bookstand... Did you come to bring my cockatoo back?" She smiles nervously, before the smile vanishes from her face.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I don't think I introduced myself..."
links.text: "I don't think I introduced myself properly -- I'm Billie. Would you like something to drink?" She looks around the kitchen. "Tea, lemonade? We're out of coffee..."

dialogueTree.title: Working Class Woman: ""It's you. From the bookstand." For..."
dialogueTree.text: "It's you. From the bookstand." For a moment she seems paralysed, just looking at you. Then she forces herself out of it.

links.title: Logic: "She must know you're here because o..."
links.text: She must know you're here because of her husband.

dialogueTree.title: Working Class Woman: ""It's you from the bookstand..." Sh..."
dialogueTree.text: "It's you from the bookstand..." She just looks at you for a moment without knowing what to do.

dialogueTree.title: Working Class Woman: ""Hello, I'm Billie. Would you like..."
dialogueTree.text: "Hello, I'm Billie. Would you like something to drink? Tea, lemonade?" she asks nervously. "We're out of coffee, I was supposed to get some tomorrow..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant has taken off his fo..."
links.text: The lieutenant has taken off his foggy glasses and is busy cleaning them in his handkerchief for now. You're on your own here.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Condensation -- from stepping insid..."
links.text: Condensation -- from stepping inside.

links.title: Empathy: "He must feel vulnerable without his..."
links.text: He must feel vulnerable without his glasses. Is this why he's letting you take the lead?

links.title: You: ""Hold on... *You're* Billie? I thou..."
links.text: "Hold on... *You're* Billie? I thought Billie was a man..."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No, I'm Billie." She narrows her e..."
links.text: "No, I'm Billie." She narrows her eyes. "Is this about my husband, Victor? I can come pick him up in the station if that's what..." She stops, her eyes trying to read answers from your face.

links.title: Composure: "Keep it together. You don't want yo..."
links.text: Keep it together. You don't want your body language to tell her the news.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Sorry, I'm rambling..." She shakes..."
links.text: "Sorry, I'm rambling..." She shakes her head and tries to laugh it off. "It's just that Victor often gets into all kinds of trouble. So, how can I help you?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "How about some small talk before yo..."
links.text: How about some small talk before you break the news?

links.title: Suggestion: "Definitely no small talk, this isn'..."
links.text: Definitely no small talk, this isn't the time or place.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "It's like ripping off a bandage. Th..."
links.text: It's like ripping off a bandage. The least painful way is to do it straight away, without stalling.

links.title: Working Class Woman: "Something changes in her expression..."
links.text: Something changes in her expression. "No, this is something much worse... Is he in a hospital? How bad is it?"

links.title: You: ""Thanks, but I'm alright.""
links.text: "Thanks, but I'm alright."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Is this about Victor, my husband?..."
links.text: "Is this about Victor, my husband? Is he in some kind of trouble again? I can come pick him up in the station if that's what..." She stops, her eyes trying to read answers from your face.

links.title: You: ""I'm not really here for the tea.""
links.text: "I'm not really here for the tea."

links.title: You: ""It's not about the cockatoo.""
links.text: "It's not about the cockatoo."

links.title: Working Class Woman: "She just nods."
links.text: She just nods.

links.title: Composure: "Keep it together. Your body languag..."
links.text: Keep it together. Your body language shouldn't give it away.

links.title: You: "Not now. [Leave.]"
links.text: Not now. [Leave.]
